programme.title: Fish or Die

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia

programme.title: Lone Star Law

programme.desc: Lucas remodels an unusable pool for a famous golfing family, creating an ocean-themed pool with fire features, an infinity edge and his first water ever couch

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert watches anxiously as Indah the Komodo dragon meets a potential mating partner. Plus, Terri deals with a phyton with an unusual lump

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The wardens are on high alert at the start of oyster season - and soon come across one crew with a large number of the molluscs. An owl is in need of rescue

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff performs surgery on a dog that cannot keep its food down and weighs 20 pounds less than it should. A cat is brought in with a bloody wound on its side

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff attends a shelter to help the pets of disadvantaged and homeless owners. At the clinic, a dog needs treatment for a growth on its head

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia presents a behind-the-scenes look at some of her favourite rescues and adoptions from the season, including some never before-seen-footage

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.sub-title: The Dogs Who Stole Our Hearts
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the pit bull shelter, beginning with a look at the dogs that had a major impact on Tias family and the parolees who helped them

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: A couple with a baby ask Lucas Congdon to come to their aid and remodel their outdated pool to make it safe for their young son to be around

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas is given the task of building a Caribbean-themed pool in a garden, but ends up arguing with his clients over the best way to proceed with the creation

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson returns to build more spectacular treehouses, beginning with a five-platform structure for a nature preserve in Michigan

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: The team welcomes a blind goat called Charlie and two ducklings. Ginger the goat embraces her new prosthetics and two pigs have a tussle

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Animal facts, including why cows are always chewing, the reason rattlesnakes release their prey and what is the loudest creature on earth. Plus, the sensitive side of rhinos

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: The experts reveal why dogs bury bones, whether elephants can detect bombs, who birds sing in the morning and what makes seahorses almost indestructible

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: In Indonesia, Forrest Galante seeks the Millers grizzled langur, or Dracula monkey. When he hears of an illegal pet market, his search becomes a rescue mission

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers discuss the bonds they form with the animals in the zoo, and reveal how these bonds strengthen their resolve to give them the best care possible

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The CEO of a family-owned winery wants a beautiful reef tank for his living room - and it needs to be done before harvest season

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz Lee and Charlotte rush to save the life of a cow, and a father-son shrimping trip takes a turn for the deadly following an encounter with a colossal calving glacier

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: Agents track down a boat captain breaking the law in Plaquemines Parish. Plus, a family of shrimpers is investigated for pulling oversized nets

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: A repeat offender is busted for taking immature crabs and a deer decoy leads to a hunter in handcuffs. Agents investigate a group of bird hunters

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 21 August 1998. Featuring Simply Red, Sweetbox, Cleopatra, Savage Garden, Babybird, Sash! feat Tina Cousins and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 28 August 1998. Featuring Sweetbox, Kavana, Alda, Spice Girls, Sheryl Crow, Foo Fighters, The Corrs, Robbie Williams and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Ed Stewart presents an episode from October 21, 1976, the second week in which Pussycats Mississippi topped the chart. The show also features performances by John Miles, Demis Roussos, Climax Blues Band, Paul Nicholas, and Steve Harley and Cockney Rebel, as well as the debut of the Top of the Pops Dancers - later to be known as Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Caron Keating present the edition first aired on October 20, featuring performances by D Mob featuring Gary Haisman, the Christians, Enya, Deacon Blue, Milli Vanilli, Erasure, Kylie Minogue, Whitney Houston and The Wee Papa Girl Rappers

programme.title: Dolly Parton at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of archive appearances by the country superstar on the BBC, including performances of Jolene, 9 to 5, Islands in the Stream and Here You Come Again. This collection showcases the enduring songwriting talents and sense of humour that first made Dollys name back in the 1970s

programme.title: Charley Pride: In Concert
programme.desc: A concert performance by American country star Charley Pride, backed by his band, The Pridesmen. Songs include San Antone, All I Have to Offer You (Is Me) and Kaw-Liga. First broadcast 15 March 1975

programme.title: Tammy
programme.desc: Tammy Wynette sings some of her favourite songs, with guests Charlie Justice, George Hamilton IV and the Tennessee Gentlemen. First broadcast 14 September 1977

programme.title: John Denver at Wembley Arena
programme.desc: A classic performance by the US musician at Londons Wembley Arena in 1979, originally shown as part of a selection of programmes to mark the 70th year since the birth of the quintessential country boy

programme.title: Shania Twain: Live in Hyde Park
programme.desc: The queen of country-pop takes to the Hyde Park stage in 2017, performing Youre Still the One, Lifes About to Get Good, Swingin with My Eyes Closed and the crowd-pleasers That Dont Impress Me Much and Man! I Feel Like a Woman

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools takes a look back at some of the stars of the country scene who have performed on the show over the years. The line-up includes Johnny Cash from 1994, a duet between Emmylou Harris and Steve Earle, and Willie Nelson. The programme also features some of the new stars of country, including Taylor Swifts 2009 debut on the show, as well as Kacey Musgraves and Maren Morris

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 21 August 1998. Featuring Simply Red, Sweetbox, Cleopatra, Savage Garden, Babybird, Sash! feat Tina Cousins and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 28 August 1998. Featuring Sweetbox, Kavana, Alda, Spice Girls, Sheryl Crow, Foo Fighters, The Corrs, Robbie Williams and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Ed Stewart presents an episode from October 21, 1976, the second week in which Pussycats Mississippi topped the chart. The show also features performances by John Miles, Demis Roussos, Climax Blues Band, Paul Nicholas, and Steve Harley and Cockney Rebel, as well as the debut of the Top of the Pops Dancers - later to be known as Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Caron Keating present the edition first aired on October 20, featuring performances by D Mob featuring Gary Haisman, the Christians, Enya, Deacon Blue, Milli Vanilli, Erasure, Kylie Minogue, Whitney Houston and The Wee Papa Girl Rappers

programme.title: The Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw meets keen gardeners Jane and Chris Goodrick from Rhuddlan in Denbighshire, and helps turn their garden into an impressive mixture of plants and shrubs

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Siegfried react very differently when the Veterinary Record publishes one of Calums articles. Rural drama based upon the novels of James Herriot, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and John McGlynn

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James wins the football pools, and Siegfried visits a farm to treat a sick cat and pulls off a brilliant piece of human diagnosis. Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.title: The Crime Is Mine
programme.desc: Penniless aspiring actress Madeleine Verdier is surprised to find herself accused of the murder of a powerful theatre producer. Her equally impoverished roommate Pauline Mauleon, an aspiring lawyer, persuades her that a sensational trial is all that is needed to give her career a much-needed boost. French period crime comedy, starring Nadia Tereszkiewicz and Isabelle Huppert

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson interviews the American actress, who chats about the fees paid while working on a film, the time the she spent with prostitutes, and her experience of being internationally famous. First broadcast in September 1971

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Imaginative re-creation of the day in 1977 when novelist Barbara Pym travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Starring Patricia Routledge, with appearances from Jilly Cooper, Penelope Lively, Hilary Pym, Hazel Holt, Henry Harvey, Tom Maschler and more. First broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Talking Heads
programme.desc: A woman acting as a self-appointed Neighbourhood Watch scheme finds her habit of writing letters to the authorities is getting ridiculously out of hand. Alan Bennetts comic monologue, performed by Patricia Routledge

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Siegfried react very differently when the Veterinary Record publishes one of Calums articles. Rural drama based upon the novels of James Herriot, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and John McGlynn

programme.title: The Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw meets keen gardeners Jane and Chris Goodrick from Rhuddlan in Denbighshire, and helps turn their garden into an impressive mixture of plants and shrubs

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James wins the football pools, and Siegfried visits a farm to treat a sick cat and pulls off a brilliant piece of human diagnosis. Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores the flamboyant court of French monarch Louis XIV at the Palace of Versailles, where he surrounded himself with aristocrats, artists, interior designers, gardeners, wig-makers, chefs and musicians. Ambitious courtiers scrambled to get closer to the king, but the bedchamber seemed to provide a more unseemly path to power

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Gaby Roslin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Police seek help in identifying a body discovered in the Claerwen reservoir. Plus, presenters Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern take a look at some of the recent convictions from appeals featured on the programme

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A one-bedroom flat in London has a potential value of £1 million and Martel Maxwell visits 25 acres of land in Anglesey. Plus, Martin Roberts is in Bristol to see a two-bedroom flat

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley hosts from antiques fair in Oswestry, Shropshire, where Leslie Kiddell-Spencer helps a father-daughter duo and Colin Young assists a mother-daughter pair to acquire items to take to auction to make the highest possible profit. Caroline also visits a nearby 70-acre sculpture park, where she sees all sorts of wildlife made from scrap metal in the company of its founder and creator Clive Knowles

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a local resident is found poisoned, the method resembles that of the Good Samaritan murderer several years earlier. As the culprit for that crime is known to be in a psychiatric institution, a copycat killer is suspected. Drama, starring Lorna Watson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young canine-loving couple from Hertfordshire are hoping for a fresh start in a new High Weald home. Their budget is £600,000, so presenter Ginny Buckley soon rustles up some tempting properties to show them. Away from the houses, Ginny picks some of the local grape harvest before treating herself to a glass of fizz

programme.title: The Repair Shop on the Road
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea and Will Kirk arrive at Aberfeldys Crannog Centre, where visitors experience recreations of 5,000 year-old traditional dwellings. The duo discover how a devastating fire put a 5,000 year-old craft in jeopardy, Chris Shaw repairs a Gaelic pipe music book and Dom has the chance to make his own sporran

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Judi Love

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: North Coast Riders
programme.desc: As storms lash the coast, Ethan Hill and his best mate Albert scour charts and forecasts, chasing a mythical wave that only breaks under rare winter conditions. Climber Ricky Bells protege Ricky tackles a complex boulder problem beneath Fair Head that demands precision, power and patience. Meanwhile, German-born freediver Hanno faces a quieter struggle. With tourist season over, he juggles jobs to stay afloat. His winter dives are cold, silent, and deeply personal. Beneath the grey surface, he finds clarity, connection, and the discipline that keeps him grounded

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In south London, Nick Knowles and the team step in to help a group of siblings grieving the recent loss of their mother. Eldest siblings Somer and Samuel have taken on the enormous responsibility of being surrogate parents, doing everything they can to hold the family together. However, with five siblings squeezed into a cramped three-bedroom house, the pressure is overwhelming. To make matters harder, the youngest, Seth, who is both blind and autistic, requires a safe and supportive environment for his additional needs

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: During his shift as a casual postman, Hungry Paul delivers a letter to himself with good news. Leonard asks Shelley to lunch and they spend an hour together, which feels like the start of something. With a proper date planned with her for that evening, Leonard cancels his usual game night with Hungry Paul. Discombobulated, Hungry Paul goes to visit Mrs Hawthorn, but realises the chocolates bought for the hospital nurses have exceeded their sell-by date. Incensed he brings them to the local shop and demands recompense. Comedy, narrated by Julia Roberts and starring Alex Lawther and Laurie Kynaston

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: After a successful first date Leonard is head over heels for Shelley, though is unnerved when he hears she is due to go to the cinema with a man called Patrick. After obsessively questioning who Patrick might be, Leonard knows he must ask Shelley outright. Elsewhere, Hungry Paul has been shortlisted for the email sign-off phrase competition and attends the awards ceremony with his family. The outcome leads to a new opportunity for him with the National Mime Association. Comedy, narrated by Julia Roberts and starring Alex Lawther and Laurie Kynaston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts, as celebrity guests Julian Clary and Sophy Ridge join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by reality star and businesswoman Kim Kardashian and award-winning actress Sarah Paulson, who are appearing together in the new TV legal drama Alls Fair. Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston chats about taking to the West End stage in All My Sons, while actress and singer Rachel Zegler also appears, fresh from wowing audiences at the London Palladium in Evita. Plus, Little Simz performs Lion, from her album Lotus

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: Alone in the Peaks with only a stick-cam, the radio presenter-turned-documentary-maker contemplates whether nature can heal a troubled mind, unlocking a heroic side some people doubted he ever had. Steve Coogan stars

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Reality competition in which contestants fight to be crowned the next superstar drag queen continues with the queens taking to the high seas for a cruise-themed talent show. Derry Girl Jamie-Lee ODonnell joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Alan Carr on the judging panel

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Max Coen and Anna Haugh, and special guest Stephen Fry, for a celebration of World Pasta Day in the studio with Finn Lagun and Roberta dElia. Drinks expert Olly Smith pairs the wines with the studio dishes, and we delve into the BBC food archive

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwalls mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earths surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Chelsea v Sunderland, Manchester United v Brighton and Hove Albion, and Everton v Tottenham Hotspur

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A team of students take on a team of balloon entertainers at Newark antiques fair, hosted by Natasha Raskin Sharp with experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon

programme.title: Live International Rugby League
programme.desc: England v Australia (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the opening fixture in the three-match Ashes series, which takes place at Wembley Stadium. This is the first series to take place since 2003, when the visiting Kangaroos won all three matches in Wigan, Hull, and Huddersfield, respectively, ensuring they claimed the Ashes for a 13th consecutive time

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoons news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Maisie Adam, Stephen Bailey, Charlotte Hawkins, Jason Mohammad, Sam Quek and Ricky Wilson take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win a cash prize. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present Icons Week, in which the celebrities - minus Chris Robshaw and Stefan Dennis - perform routines that honour some of the most influential music artists of all time. Judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke offer their opinions before the public vote opens

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance. The celebrities are Susan Wokoma, Roman Kemp, Layton Williams, Katherine Ryan, Jill Scott, Joe Marler, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: Air authorities search for the plane, and federal agencies spring into action. As the group becomes smaller, the last survivors know they are going to have to fight to stay alive

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Sunderland at Stamford Bridge, and Brentford v Liverpool at Gtech Community Stadium. The Blues and Black Cats had identical records prior to the most recent international break, suggesting their encounter would be closer than the 5-1 victory Chelsea recorded when they last hosted Sunderland in 2017. Meanwhile, the Bees were looking to halt a run of five consecutive losses against the Reds. Plus, action from Newcastle United v Fulham, and Manchester United v Brighton and Hove Albion

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers talks to Chelsea and England star Reece James

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John and Quiet make a pitstop, where John reunites with a former contact. Sweet Tooth bonds with a new follower

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John is faced with the ultimate decision between honouring his past or embracing his future

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by reality star and businesswoman Kim Kardashian and award-winning actress Sarah Paulson, who are appearing together in the new TV legal drama Alls Fair. programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The sheep gobble up a birthday cake baked for the Farmer. Realising the kitchen cupboards are bare, Shaun and the flock source ingredients for a new one

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: While putting up a new shelf, the Farmer accidentally drills a hole in a waterpipe. Bitzer tries frantically to stop the leak from soaking the living room and prevent the Farmers precious teapots from sliding off the shelf

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun tricks Bitzer into thinking he is unwell so that he can stay in the barn playing video games all day. However, before long, the other sheep are also pulling sickies

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep: The Shirleyverse
programme.desc: One-off special, in which Shaun escapes through a portal inside Shirleys wool to flee an annoying Bitzer, only to emerge into a chaotic version of the farm where he does not exist. Desperate to escape, he repeatedly jumps back inside Shirley, emerging somewhere worse each time

programme.title: A Shaun the Sheep Movie: Farmageddon
programme.desc: When an alien with amazing powers crash-lands near Mossy Bottom Farm, Shaun the Sheep goes on a mission to shepherd the intergalactic visitor home before a sinister organisation can capture her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Justin Fletcher, John Sparkes and Amalia Vitale

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers presents coverage of day three at the Velodromo Peñalolen in Santiago, Chile, plus a round of action from days one and two. Britains Josh Charlton is expected to be in action in the mens individual pursuit final, while medals will also be decided in the mens time trial and womens sprint. With analysis from Laura Kenny

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Reality competition in which contestants fight to be crowned the next superstar drag queen continues with the queens taking to the high seas for a cruise-themed talent show. Derry Girl Jamie-Lee ODonnell joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Alan Carr on the judging panel

programme.title: My Mates a Bad Date
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Khalil from Nottingham cannot get a second date. Oloni thinks that remembering his dates names, dropping the baby girl tag and cooling off on the bragging might help his chances

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Sarah Keyworth hosts, as second heat contenders Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh take to the stage of Birminghams Hockley Social Club in a bid to book their place in the final. programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After an odd text from Harrys phone, Teddy shares his worries with Billy. Meanwhile, Okie is fuming at Harry and insists he calls Kojo to tell him to return to the handlers. Nigel reels from his actions, Kat makes a worrying discovery, and Johnny considers a new business venture

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The events of the accident play on Nigels mind, and Julie attempts to conceal the truth. Meanwhile, Kat follows Zoe to a clandestine meet with a private investigator to confront her about the stolen money

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Its tense between Kat and Zoe, but their attention soon turns to a cat trapped in the Vic. Zoe makes amends with her mum, but then drops a bombshell. Nigel is determined for the truth to come out, and Billy is irked when Johnny tries to win Lexis affection with gifts

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Staceys brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best mans speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: When hedonistic 24-year-old Gemma discovers she is pregnant after a one-night stand, she has no choice but to turn to her hapless father, Malcolm, for support. A sweet-but-lost man in a domestic crisis, he must learn to rebuild his relationship with his daughter, though they soon find living together will prove difficult. Sitcom, starring Aimee Lou Wood and David Morrissey

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma realises she needs more female support. After a chance encounter with an old friend, Gemma agrees to go to a party to try and reconnect with girls from school. programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

The pair are focussing their attentions on the Marbella area, with its holiday vibes and also its quieter traditional locations. Slay queens flaunt luxury lifestyles online funded by wealthy blessers - inspiring both admiration and anger. As Symeon Brown reports, to their followers, theyre glamorous entrepreneurs breaking free from poverty and oppression. To their critics, theyre dangerous gold diggers who blur the lines between dating, sex work - and scams

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: My Comedy Heroes
programme.desc: Bradley unpacks what it takes to make it as a double act while also celebrating his favourite comedy duos of all time. Do opposites attract as with the Two Ronnies and French and Saunders, or is it a case of them sharing a sense of the world and why its funny, like Fry and Laurie or Armstrong and Miller? The presenter challenges todays comedy stars to unravel the secrets of the genre, and there are archive clips and first-hand anecdotes from Bradleys life in the business

programme.title: Morecambe and Wise: The Unseen Tapes
programme.desc: Rare footage of the comedy duo entertaining the nation, along with testimony some of their famous guests, including Judi Dench, Wayne Sleep, Rula Lenska and Valerie Singleton, recalling what it was like to work with the pair. The programme also includes Erics last TV recording, for a programme that was never transmitted, and Ernies role in a US sitcom

programme.title: Fergie: Where Did All the Money Go?
programme.desc: Sarah, Duchess of York, has lived a life of extraordinary highs and crushing lows-especially when it comes to her finances. From marrying into the British Royal Family to facing near-bankruptcy, her journey has been nothing short of dramatic and this programme examines how a duchess with access to immense wealth found herself in financial turmoil time and time again, but has always managed to bounce back. Featuring a wealth of archive footage from throughout her life, as well as interviews with friends, financial experts and royal commentators

programme.desc: The families take a trip to Disneyland, where Mitch and Cameron are forced to cope with Lilys new-found love of running, and Jay and Gloria argue over sensible footwear. Meanwhile, Claire is far from pleased when she bumps into Haleys ex-boyfriend Dylan, and Phil struggles to keep up with Luke

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is placed in the awkward position of having to fire Mitchell, while Cameron and Claire clash over their opposing theories on how to discipline children. Manny loses his temper when Luke accepts an award under false pretences, and Jay argues with Gloria over their lunch at a local diner

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, but Penny and Raj get along so well together that Leonard starts to feel left out. Sheldon expresses an interest in Amys work and they begin to collaborate on a scientific project

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon pushes himself to the limit when he collaborates on two scientific projects - one with Leonard and Howard, plus another with Amy - on the same day. Bernadette nears the end of her maternity leave, and looks forward to returning to work

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard and Bernadette find it upsetting to leave baby Halley at the nursery when Bernadette returns to work at the end of her maternity leave. The gangs university colleague Bert the geologist introduces them to his attractive new girlfriend Rebecca

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard isnt thrilled when he finds out Penny is considering taking a new job that has been offered to her by her former boyfriend Zack. Sheldon attempts to develop his brain further by learning new skills

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Desperate circumstances call for desperate measures as Peralta, Captain Holt, Santiago, Jeffords, Diaz and Boyle are forced to ally themselves with some old enemies

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake leads a manhunt after an assassination attempt on a city councillor, while Holt adjusts to his new position as a uniformed officer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer gets Flanders a job as a human resources supervisor at the plant. However, he soon learns that no good deed goes unpunished when his neighbour starts to insist on carpools and demands more from his work performance. Matters reach a head when Flanders suggests Mr Burns donate to charities - instead of the other way around. Meanwhile, Marge feels as though their marriage has lost its spark

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: An insurance payout sends the Simpsons on a trip to Denmark, where they hope to get free healthcare for Grampa, who needs a serious operation

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon petitions Wil Wheaton to allow him to appear on the new Professor Proton show, so the actor offers a guest appearance to Amy instead. Meanwhile, Penny gets angry when she thinks the female protagonist in Leonards novel is based on her

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadettes friends each try different tactics to help her go into labour. Howard isnt happy when he finds out that Bernadette has already chosen their sons name without his input

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While Leonard jumps through hoops to help secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy, Howard and Bernadette have a difficult time deciding which one of them should stay at home with the kids and who should return to work

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets the opportunity to spend time with Bill Gates at work, because his business wants to partner with her pharmaceutical company. Leonard, Howard and Raj do everything in their power to also meet the high-tech entrepreneur, while Sheldon thinks hes the victim of an April Fools Day prank

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is duped into enlisting in the army, and falls foul of a hard-nosed officer who uses him as the target in a training exercise. Escaping back to Springfield with troops in hot pursuit, he makes his way home - where Marges ingenuity saves the day. With the guest voice of Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe becomes a successful poet with Lisas help, and wins the approval of a group of highbrow authors - but enjoys the limelight so much that he claims all the credit for himself, prompting her to seek revenge

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
programme.desc: Marge takes Lisa for her first manicure at the salon, where they debate whether a woman can be smart, beautiful and powerful all at the same time. Four tales featuring strong women from history and literature are retold with Selma appearing as Elizabeth I, Lisa as Snow White, Marge as Lady Macbeth and Maggie as Howard Roark from The Fountainhead

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
programme.desc: Homer and Marge take the kids to Diz-Nee Land, where they soon become exasperated by the amusement parks lengthy queues, until they discover a ride that transports them to the home planet of Kang and Kodos

programme.title: Supercruising: Life at Sea
programme.desc: Dancer Summer from Milton Keynes is one of the newest recruits to the crew sailing the Caribbean, and is acclimatising to performing on a rocky stage while missing family back home. On the ship sailing North Africa and Europe, the chefs are prepping a fine-dining experience fusing Japanese and Western cuisines. In Europe, a Dutch family brave some unseasonal pouring rain on a Tuk Tuk tour around Porto

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: A repairman is assigned to salvage the remaining resources from Earth, which has been left a devastated wasteland after a war with an alien race. He discovers a human survivor on the surface of the planet, an encounter that exposes secrets from the past that threaten the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure, starring Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.sub-title: Best Naughty Bits: Naked, Crazy, Stupid Love
programme.desc: A romp through the Naked Attraction archive to catch up with dates that led to full-on romances - as well as some that turned out to be a disaster. They include Wolverhampton DJ Darryl from series one, who found his partner in Maria, and Scottish bombshell Amira from series five, who gives the lowdown on what really happened between her and Ste after their night of passion

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.sub-title: Naked Attraction: All Out and Proud
programme.desc: Anna Richardson hosts a Pride special, celebrating all of the most memorable singletons from across the sexual spectrum. Plus, a chance to catch up with some of the unforgettable pickers, including 75-year-old bisexual Ian - the shows oldest ever picker, Raheem the professional dancer looking to pop his gay cherry, and transfeminine singleton Callie, who came on the show to find her first proper date

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including After Life, This Morning, Coronation Street, Britains Got Talent, Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On, and BBC news coverage of President Trumps comments on China. From May 2020

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: After the guests complain about the service, Daisy is confronted by two crew members. The glitz and glam arrive as a drag queen duo and their witty friends sashay onto the boat

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Mook, the Chef, the Wife and Her Homer
programme.desc: Homer volunteers to take Fat Tonys place as the head of the local Mafia, dragging the rest of the Simpson family into Springfields criminal underworld. With the guest voices of metal band Metallica and Sopranos stars Joe Pantoliano and Michael Imperioli

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
programme.desc: Marge takes Lisa for her first manicure at the salon, where they debate whether a woman can be smart, beautiful and powerful all at the same time. Four tales featuring strong women from history and literature are retold with Selma appearing as Elizabeth I, Lisa as Snow White, Marge as Lady Macbeth and Maggie as Howard Roark from The Fountainhead

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is determined to make up for her less-than-joyful mood at Jay and Glorias wedding by throwing their 10th anniversary party, at which Phil plans to perform a magic trick

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay makes a Thanksgiving toast to everyones recent success. But it turns out that some havent told the truth about their triumphs

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave is eager to take on a bigger role in the community and prove himself to Calvin, whose reaction makes it clear that their friendship needs more time

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Grover gets into a fight with a bully at school, and Gemma is torn between her role as principal and wanting to protect her son. Calvin encourages Marty to stand up for himself

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: The family pays tribute to Pops, venturing down memory lane by visiting his favourite stomping grounds. Return of the comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly disrupts Adams college admission plans, while Erica discovers that her future father-in-law blames her for a prank she was not responsible for

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry and Adam join forces to save a local water park that is being threatened with closure, while the planning of the wedding opens a rift between Beverly and Erica

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam films his high-schools final football game of the year, but misses the winning touchdown. Beverly discovers her neighbour is moving and is determined to buy his home.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barrys case of poison ivy causes problems for Erica and Geoff, while having Mr Glascott living next door presents a challenge for the family

programme.title: Wedding March 5: My Boyfriends Back
programme.desc: A couple running an inn used as a wedding venue agree to help an ambitious young wedding planner with her latest big day. But she will need all the help she can get when she realises the best man is her ex-boyfriend. Romantic drama, starring Jack Wagner and Josie Bissett

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: News of Alice and Sam Vanderpumps pregnancy is doing the rounds, but theres one very important person who still needs to be told - his notoriously opinionated aunt, Lisa Vanderpump. Shes over from LA and the couple plan to meet with her to reveal the news of the expanding dynasty. Jazz and Juless friendship is on shaky ground, and Juless bond with Livvy threatens to push them further apart

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Greek at the Harbour restaurant in southern California, where owner Makis Mikelatos works 17 hours a day, seven days a week, but is unwilling to let his son Ari take the reins. Gordon sets out to get to the bottom of Makiss reluctance to teach his son, and uncovers a shocking family secret

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels to the El Greco restaurant in Austin, Texas, where the owners have resorted to using a microwave to prepare their authentic Greek dishes. Gordon faces the difficult task of uniting a squabbling family before tackling the bigger problem of a business on the brink of collapse

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: Lemony Snickets A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the childrens books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny attempt to prove Sheldon wrong when he claims that he and Amy have a superior relationship. Meanwhile, Howard is nervous when Nasa asks him to throw the first pitch at a baseball game honouring National Space Day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Rajs girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuarts comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to revise for a work assessment during the girls trip to Las Vegas, and Amy and Bernadette accuse her of spoiling their fun. Meanwhile, the guys try to invent something of scientific importance - but only come up with new ways to procrastinate. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny ask Howard and Bernadette for advice when they argue about money. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj try to find out whether they could survive a dark matter research expedition in a salt mine by attempting to simulate the conditions in a steam tunnel beneath the university. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart discovers a hidden musical talent with the help of a sympathetic child psychologist, and quickly becomes an acclaimed jazz drummer - causing Lisa to feel envious of his success. With the voices of the White Stripes

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge starts a carpentry business, but quickly learns she will need more than mere practical skill if her venture is to succeed. Fearing she will not be taken seriously, she appoints Homer as a figurehead - but he begins taking all the credit for her labours. Meanwhile, Bart is thrilled to discover Principal Skinner has a lethal peanut allergy

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Halloween-inspired tales featuring the all-American family. Springfield becomes the target of an alien invasion and Homer is transformed into a gigantic jelly-like creature, rampaging through the town and leaving a trail of destruction in his wake. Featuring the guest voice of Dr Phil

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is duped into enlisting in the army, and falls foul of a hard-nosed officer who uses him as the target in a training exercise. Escaping back to Springfield with troops in hot pursuit, he makes his way home - where Marges ingenuity saves the day. With the guest voice of Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces including Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Rylan and his mother Linda, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe, Melanie C and her brother Paul, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Judi Love and Charlene White, Denise Van Outen and Duncan James, Gyles Brandreth and Carol Vorderman, Stacey Solomon and Joe Swash, Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont, Martin and Roman Kemp, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Richard Jones, and Emma and Matt Willis share their thoughts on The Baby, One Question, Million Pound Pawn, CODA, America the Beautiful, The Laundry Guy and The One That Got Away

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Trigger Point, One Day, Married at First Sight Australia, Sort Your Life Out, Into the Congo with Ben Fogle and Earthsounds. They also appraise a feature about rumpology aired on This Morning and BBC news reports on a by-election in Rochdale. From March 2024

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Gentlemen, Casualty, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Crufts 2024, Queens and Martin Compstons Norwegian Fling. They also critique ITV News coverage of the Princess of Wales apparently manipulated Mothers Day photograph

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Teacher and self-confessed cougar Marie returns to the restaurant for a date with 32-year-old lighting technician Adrian, while sports enthusiast Stephanie is matched with former rugby player Stuart. Plus, 71-year-old Janet and 87-year-old former soldier George bond over their shared love of travel and even joke about jetting off to Venezuela together

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Eighteen-year-old rookie beautician Ruby returns to the restaurant to dine with 20-year-old trainee auctioneer Adam, while 24-year-old waitress Charlotte returns to the dating scene having been widowed a year earlier. Will 24-year-old junior stockbroker Jamie be the gentleman shes looking for? Teresa is 66 and hasnt been on a date for 20 years, so hopes James, who loves Jay Z and Akon, can match her enthusiasm and keep her entertained

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Atlanta, Georgia, in an attempt to save a family-run smokehouse restaurant plagued by mismanagement and lazy cooking. Michons owner, Al Wilson, had always hoped he could pass his beloved business on to daughter Natalie, but when he suffered a collapsed lung the handover came about much earlier than expected. Now its down to Gordon to motivate Natalie and save Michons from disaster

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Philadelphia to help failing Mexican restaurant Zocalo. Owners Greg and Mary Russell met and fell in love while they were working there, and the place held such sentimental importance to them they pooled their money and bought it. Now Gordon tries to turn things around before the floundering business ruins their marriage and tears their family apart

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: The team presents more news from the remote Canadian town of Churchill on the edge of the Arctic. Kate Humble meets the Inuit artists inspired by the changing world around them, and Gordon Buchanan finds out how the townsfolk deal with the more troublesome bears when he follows the eviction of a repeat offender. Plus, a live report from the tundra on how the bears are getting on

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan visits Churchill, Manitoba, a Canadian town where humans live in close proximity to polar bears. For two months of every year, the animals gather in the area, waiting for sea ice to form so they can head north for their winter hunt. Gordon meets local police officers and refuse collectors who have to work in close proximity to the bears and meets a woman who was mauled on the towns main street

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon presents highlights of his journeys around the world, and catches up with the people he met, including a Burmese undercover human rights campaigner, a homeless woman living in a Hollywood railway bridge, and a 10 year-old boy he met working in terrible conditions in a glass factory in Bangladesh

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon recalls some of the most dangerous experiences of his travels, from coming under fire in war-torn Mogadishu to squaring off with a female wrestler in Mexico City. Among the past destinations featured are a police cell in the far east of Russia, and the programme also looks back at his encounters with ambulance crews in San Salvador and anti-smuggling police in Italy

programme.title: Carrington VC
programme.desc: A decorated Army major resorts to embezzling mess funds to make ends meet - an act that leaves him facing a court martial, with the evidence stacked against him. To make matters worse, his wife sees the opportunity to get revenge for his wartime affairs by providing false testimony for the prosecution. Courtroom drama, starring David Niven, Margaret Leighton, Noelle Middleton, Laurence Naismith and Clive Morton

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: The captain of an American destroyer in the South Atlantic is still recovering from the sinking of his previous vessel. He tries to outwit a cunning German U-boat commander, but comes to respect the courage of his enemy. However, his crew fears he is not up to the challenge of defeating his opponent. Second World War thriller, starring Robert Mitchum, Curt Jurgens, Theodore Bikel and David Hedison

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: A homesteader and his son fall foul of a crooked gambler, who makes off with the farmers horse and rifle and leaves behind his abandoned girlfriend. However, the three of them are forced to flee by river on a raft when their farm comes under attack. Western, starring Robert Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe and Rory Calhoun

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about the making of the Cold War espionage drama

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: Secret Service agent Mike Banning is framed for an assassination attempt on the President. Pursued by his own agency and the FBI, Banning races to clear his name and uncover the real terrorist threat - which has set its sights on Air Force One. Action thriller sequel, starring Gerard Butler and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: X.
programme.desc: Film producer Wayne bankrolls X-rated fantasy The Farmers Daughters featuring his fame-hungry girlfriend Maxine, burlesque dancer Bobby-Lynne and porn star Jackson Hole. The film-makers venture into the Texan countryside to shoot on location at a farm belonging to elderly couple Howard and Pearl. However, before long the cast are fighting for their lives. Seventies-set horror, starring Mia Goth, Brittany Snow and Jenna Ortega

programme.title: The Innocents
programme.desc: A highly strung vicars daughter takes up the post of governess to two orphaned children living with their servants in a sprawling Gothic mansion. She learns of the scandalous history of her predecessor and her lover, and suspects their spirits are the cause of her charges disquieting behaviour. Horror, based on Henry James short story The Turn of the Screw, starring Deborah Kerr, Michael Redgrave, Peter Wyngarde and Megs Jenkins

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine OHara and John Candy

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: The Popes Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist of the Vatican, investigates a rundown abbey in San Sebastian. The owner, Julia, claims her 12-year-old son Henry has been possessed by a demon. Local priest Father Esquibel is unprepared to tackle the profanity-spewing malevolence, so Amorth lends his years of experience to the case. Horror, starring Russell Crowe and Daniel Zovatto

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: In 1918 Texas, teenager Pearl dreams of becoming a dancer in Hollywood in direct opposition to her domineering German immigrant mother. The projectionist of the local cinema fans the flames of the teenagers rebellion and mother and daughter clash violently. Horror, starring Mia Goth and David Corenswet

programme.title: Smile
programme.desc: Dr Rose Cotter works in the emergency psychiatric unit of a busy hospital, tending to troubled patients including a new arrival, Laura Weaver. After witnessing a traumatic incident involving Laura, Rose becomes convinced she is being threatened by an uncanny entity. Horror, starring Sosie Bacon, Kyle Gallner and Jessie T Usher

programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friends daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After seven years of ducking the issue, Lewis and Hobson are embarking on a relationship, but the detective also has a new case to solve. Elderly don Richard Seager is murdered on the night of his release from prison, having served a sentence for causing death by dangerous driving. Crushed by a classic car, Seager mysteriously scratched the number 500 into its paintwork before his demise, and the academics wife suspects a member of his victims family is responsible for the killing. With Stephen Churchett, Alison Steadman and Edward Fox

programme.desc: The inspector and his sidekick DS Hathaway investigate the murder of a talented maths student. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oxfords last-surviving all-female college is holding a reunion to bid farewell to one of its most prominent professors. However, the evening leads to tragedy when a guest is found murdered, and Lewis is convinced the killing is connected to an attack that occurred at the same institution 10 years previously. The detective calls in his former DS, Alison McLennan, to help with the investigation, but the case takes a twist when two more bodies turn up. Crime drama, guest starring Juliet Stevenson and Saskia Reeves, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margolyes

programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary and Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders Little Mo)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The life of an eccentric and reclusive couple comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator is killed, and Barnaby must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the murderer. Meanwhile, the detectives wife Sarah (Fiona Dolman, The Royal Today) arrives in Midsomer as the new head of a local school. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A mother of two is found murdered in her back garden. Vera and Aiden investigate the case, and delve into the disturbing secrets and ongoing conflicts that lurk beneath the surface of the victims seemingly peaceful suburban community. The case takes a more complicated turn when the dead womans estranged family make an unexpected reappearance, and while several of her neighbours may have had cause to carry out a crime of passion, her relatives may have had compelling motives of their own to kill. Guest starring Rita Tushingham

programme.title: Vera

Joined by her faithful team, including DC Kenny Lockhart and new recruit DC Jac Williams, Vera attempts to find the missing link that will crack the case, but finds it difficult to get to the truth when everyone they encounter seems to be protecting a secret. programme.desc: Jacqui Oatley is joined by Alan Warriner-Little and Chris Mason to present coverage of day two from Westfalenhallen in Dortmund, Germany, featuring eight first-round matches played over the best of 11 legs. Luke Humphries was in fine form at this stage 12 months ago, recording a 6-2 victory over Nathan Aspinall, while Luke Littler suffered a shock 6-4 defeat to Andrew Gilding. Elsewhere, eventual tunner-up Jermaine Wattimena produced a stunning 6-0 whitewash of the number 10 seed Peter Wright, and his fellow Dutchman Danny Noppert triumphed 6-2 over Joe Cullen. Commentary comes from Stuart Pyke, John Rawling, and Ned Boulting

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: General manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty welcome their rivals to the Cliffemount Hotel in Runswick Bay in North Yorkshire. Guests Lana and Alistair are wowed by the views, but Belgian sisters Daniele and Chantal dont think the decor reflects their surroundings. After an afternoon fossil hunting on the beach, Garry entertains his guests at dinner with a taste of his past, and gives them a sight to remember. In the morning, Claire and Adam think their breakfast lacks flavour, and the feedback leaves Garry and Zara wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Hospitality newcomers Alistair Arundel and Lana Keptanare welcome their rivals to the Quayside Hotel in Boston in Lincolnshire. Most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels like shes stuck in a neon nightmare. Feathers are ruffled during an afternoon of parrot-handling, with Garry and Zara feeling that Claire and Adam have shown their true colours. At dinner, the guests are impressed by Alistair and Lanas renovation story, but Alistair takes a dim view of Claires LED criticism

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Lennon and Adam De Marco welcome their rivals to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, Berkshire. Sisters Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers but the other guests are shocked by the communal composting toilet. After an arty afternoon, Garry and Zara put aside their differences with their hosts. At dinner, Lana and Alistair dont hold back their feelings about camping, and at breakfast they reveal the full horror of their night under the stars. The feedback reveals that sharing isnt caring when it comes to the communal composting loo, and Claire and Adam have to face the fact that glamping isnt to everyones taste

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sisters Daniele Spiers and Chantal Wirth welcome their rivals to Swan House in Kelvedon in Essex. The traditional decor impresses the guests, but theres cleanliness criticism all round, and Lana has wardrobe woes. During an afternoon of wine tasting, Claire and Adam reveal that their feedback hasnt left a bad taste in the mouth, and over dinner the group finds out more about Danieles romantic past. In the morning, Garry and Zara wake up on the wrong side of bed after a disturbed nights sleep

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on a 1924 Austin 7 Chummy - that doesnt actually belong to its owner. Former painter and decorator Christopher actually bought the Austin back in the early 1960s - it was his first car and as an enthusiastic teenager took on a full rebuild

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and parts-blagging petrolhead Tim Shaw restore a British pocket rocket - a 1997 Lotus Elise. The vehicle belongs to a cancer patient who had hoped to restore it with her father

While new couple Justin and Richard are prepared to make a canine commitment, Bear the yorkipoo seems likely to give them a run for their money. Lizzie and Jason are the proud parents of Billy, a street dog from Spain, but they cant help him lose his fear of others. Could Evie the lurcher help?

programme.desc: The body of the leader of the Abbey is found very close to where Veronique was killed. Is there a link between two murders that occurred more than 30 years apart? In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

programme.desc: Paramedics find a woman whos fallen, is on blood thinners and may have a bleed on the brain. programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces

Plus, a trip to Tuscany and Georges own star gazing treehouse in Kielder National Park, Northumberland

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Tammy and Stuart live in a pretty village in West Sussex but their bungalow is outdated, with its main living rooms starved of light. The couple are desperate to create a family home but their options are severely limited. Enter architect Will Alsop, who designs a dramatic barrel-vaulted extension to the rear of the bungalow, complete with specially constructed exposed curved beams, an aluminium roof and porthole windows. programme.desc: Pilots who dealt with crises in the air and saved their planes from crashing, including one of the most remarkable landings in the history of commercial flying

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Oil worker Steve has owned his 1967 Aston Martin DB6 for over 20 years. After he bought it for a bargain price the car became his pride and joy, but when it broke down his attempts to repair it failed. Since then, a serious fall and chronic health problems have taken their toll and restoring the British classic is now out of his reach. While Fuzz Townshend struggles with an engine that hasnt turned over in 20 years, Tim Shaw must do his best to get all the right parts - which are notoriously expensive

programme.title: Construction Fails
programme.desc: Urban construction relies on two types of cranes to hoist the next high-rise - but when they fail, they make one big mess. Plus, discover the bad side of escalators

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures
programme.desc: Documenting the extraordinary defences and kill zones that surrounded Hitlers bunker in Berlin, which was a subterranean safehouse protected with 13ft-thick walls to keep the fuhrer safe from any attack the allies could throw at him from the air

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures
programme.desc: Uncovering what is left of Hitlers ambitious structures, which were built in a bid for world domination. A secret headquarters of concrete and steel lay at the heart of the fuhrers plans for global domination and was the key to a Nazi conspiracy - the Wolfs Lair

programme.title: Killing Hitler
programme.desc: An attempt on Hitlers life must now come from within. A small group risk their lives to plot the assassination

programme.title: Lost Treasures of Egypt

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: A private jet slams into an apartment building near the runway, killing all nine passengers. Investigators uncover an erratic descent, a puzzling delay, and a tragic perfect storm

programme.title: Bloody Tales of the Tower
programme.desc: Historian Suzannah Lipscomb and journalist Joe Crowley investigate stories connected to the Tower of London, looking at the contrasting fates of three people imprisoned in the Tower of London for treason. They examine what happened to Jesuit priest Fr John Gerard after he was accused of being sent by the pope to overthrow Elizabeth I, and look at the cases of Gunpowder Plot conspirator Guy Fawkes and German spy Josef Jakobs, who was captured in 1941 after breaking his ankle while parachuting into England on a mission

programme.title: Bloody Tales of the Tower
programme.desc: Tudor historian Suzannah Lipscomb and journalist Joe Crowley investigate the history of the Tower of London, examining stories that challenge accepted beliefs about the infamous prison using original historical sources and dramatic reconstructions. Here they consider why it took executioner John Ketch five blows to decapitate the Duke of Monmouth in July 1685, and examine whether former inmate Lady Jane Grey had a legitimate claim to the English throne. They also look into how a ragtag gang managed to breach its defences during the Peasants Revolt in June 1381 and killed Simon of Sudbury, the Archbishop of Canterbury

programme.title: Bloody Tales of the Tower
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb and Joe Crowley examine the evidence and report on the intrigues that led to three royal deaths, detailing the sometimes salacious accusations levelled at Anne Boleyn, Catherine Howard and Lady Arabella Seymour. Henry VIIIs chief minister Thomas Cromwell informed the monarch of gossip about Anne and court musician Mark Smeaton, but allegations at her public trial included adultery with five men, incest with her brother George and treason. Rumours of relationships with distant cousin Francis Dereham and Thomas Culpeper led to Catherine Howards execution, while Lady Arabella, a serious threat to the ruling Stuart dynasty, is thought to have committed suicide against a backdrop of a cross-dressing noblewoman and two escapes from the Tower

programme.title: Air Crash Investigation
programme.desc: In June 1982, the engines of British Airways Flight 009 failed after it flew through volcanic ash caused by an eruption and the plane began falling from the sky. Minutes before it would have crashed into the sea the engines roared back to life - narrowly avoiding a catastrophe. The investigation looks at the lessons learned from the incident, which changed the way pilots were trained

Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

Malcolm from the West Midlands bring the team an old fishing reel that once belonged to his grandad Wilf. Expert Steve Fletcher has a turn at fixing up the jammed-up reel so Malcolm can return to the water. Suzie Fletcher is tasked with fixing up Catherines pig-shaped footstool named Pogo. programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Tinks is a disability assistance dog for her owner Charli, who has a condition that makes it painful for her to pick things up or to push and pull things. Tinks uses her super fetch skills to help Charli every day. The smallest of the Dog Squad gang, Tinks is a little Lhasa apso with lots of big dog energy. Charli is meeting her friend Annabel for lunch at the local cafe. They havent been out for a lunch treat for ages, and the cafes speciality is Tinkss favourite - chicken. First, Charli parks her car using her blue parking badge and then gets her wheelchair out of the boot using a hoist. Tinks then helps Charli go into the cafe, find a table and go to the counter to order their lunch. But when the cafe owner sees Tinks, he tells Charli that they only allow in guide dogs and that Tinks will have to wait outside. Brave Tinks summons all her big dog energy to help Charli persuade the owner to let them stay and enjoy their chicken sandwich.
